benchmark_details.name: MMADE (MultiModal Adverse Drug Event Detection Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: The MMADE dataset merges ADE-related textual information with visual aids to enhance the detection of adverse drug events using both text and images.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance the detection of adverse drug events by leveraging both textual and visual data.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset primarily focuses on drug events associated with external body parts, omitting internal conditions.

data.source: Social media, healthcare blogs, medical case reports
data.annotation: Manually annotated by medical students and a Ph.D. student according to a specified manual.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on standard evaluation procedures comparing model outputs against reference texts.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment and similarity between generated and reference texts.
methodology.validation: Statistical t-tests were conducted to assess performance differences between unimodal and multimodal models.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Dataset contains only AD images and corresponding text without personal user information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Dataset shared for research purposes only, with no license for commercial use.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent obtained from annotators, fulfilling ethical standards.
